parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post refers to Neculai Moraru, the mayor of Fălciu, but not in the context of a parliamentary election.  The post is a message celebrating Romania's National Day.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a public Facebook post, paid for by Moldova Invest, and addresses the population of Fălciu and potentially a wider audience interested in local news and events. The message is not a private communication.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to convey a message from the mayor on Romania's National Day. There is no explicit or implicit call to vote for or against any candidate in a parliamentary election.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post can be considered a form of local news reporting, conveying a public message from a local official. It's not intended to influence the vote in any election.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. It's not a personal opinion; it's an official message from the mayor.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>557812403852836</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post is a message from the mayor of Fălciu on Romania's National Day.  While the post features the mayor's image, it does not promote him in the context of a parliamentary election. The content is celebratory and does not advocate for or against any candidate. The paid nature of the post on a public platform does not automatically make it electoral propaganda. The post's objective is to communicate a festive message, not to influence voters in an election.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Moldova Invest</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
